items.name: CALSOR
items.description: XSPI DLL slave output calibration configuration

items.name: CALSIR
items.description: XSPI DLL slave input calibration configuration

fields.name: ALTERNATE
fields.description: Alternate bytes Optional data to be sent to the external SPI device right after the address.

fields.name: ADDRESS
fields.description: Address Address to be sent to the external device. In HyperBus protocol, this field must be even as this protocol is 16-bit word oriented. In dual-memory configuration, AR[0] is forced to 0.  Writes to this field are ignored when BUSY = 1 or when FMODE = 11 (memory-mapped mode). Some memory specifications consider that each address corresponds to a 16-bit value. XSPI considers that each address corresponds to an 8-bit value. So the software needs to multiple the address by two when accessing the memory registers.

fields.name: FINE
fields.description: Fine calibration The unitary value of delay for this field depends on product technology (refer to the product datasheet).

fields.name: COARSE
fields.description: Coarse calibration The unitary value of delay for this field depends on product technology (refer to the product datasheet).

fields.name: CALMAX
fields.description: Max value This bit gets set when the memory-clock period is outside the range of DLL master, in which case XSPI_CALFCR and XSPI_CALSR are updated with the values for the maximum delay.

fields.name: FINE
fields.description: Fine calibration The unitary value of delay for this field depends on product technology (refer to the product datasheet).

fields.name: COARSE
fields.description: Coarse calibration The unitary value of delay for this field depends on product technology (refer to the product datasheet).

fieldset/CALSOR.description: XSPI DLL slave output calibration configuration

fields.name: FINE
fields.description: Fine calibration The unitary value of delay for this field depends on product technology (refer to the product datasheet).

fields.name: COARSE
fields.description: Coarse calibration The unitary value of delay for this field depends on product technology (refer to the product datasheet).

fields.name: IMODE
fields.description: Instruction mode This field defines the instruction phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: IDTR
fields.description: Instruction double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the instruction phase.

fields.name: ISIZE
fields.description: Instruction size This bit defines instruction size.

fields.name: ADMODE
fields.description: Address mode This field defines the address phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: ADDTR
fields.description: Address double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the address phase.

fields.name: ADSIZE
fields.description: Address size This field defines address size.

fields.name: ABMODE
fields.description: Alternate-byte mode This field defines the alternate byte phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: ABDTR
fields.description: Alternate bytes double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the alternate bytes phase. Note: This field can be written only when BUSY = 0.

fields.name: ABSIZE
fields.description: Alternate bytes size This bit defines alternate bytes size.

fields.name: DMODE
fields.description: Data mode This field defines the data phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: DDTR
fields.description: Data double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the data phase.

fields.name: DQSE
fields.description: DQS enable This bit enables the data strobe management.

fields.name: EN
fields.description: Enable This bit enables the XSPI. The DMA request can be aborted without having received the ACK in case this EN bit is cleared during the operation. Note: In case this bit is set to 0 during a DMA transfer, the REQ signal to DMA returns to inactive state without waiting for the ACK signal from DMA to be active.

fields.name: ABORT
fields.description: Abort request This bit aborts the on-going command sequence. It is automatically reset once the abort is completed. This bit stops the current transfer. Note: This bit is always read as 0.

fields.name: DMAEN
fields.description: DMA enable In indirect mode, the DMA can be used to input or output data via XSPI_DR. DMA transfers are initiated when FTF is set.  Note: Resetting the DMAEN bit while a DMA transfer is ongoing, breaks the handshake with the DMA. Do not write this bit during DMA operation.

fields.name: TCEN
fields.description: Timeout counter enable This bit is valid only when the memory-mapped mode (FMODE[1:0] = 11) is selected. This bit enables the timeout counter. Note: This bit can be modified only when BUSY = 0.

fields.name: DMM
fields.description: Dual-memory configuration This bit activates the dual-memory configuration, where two external devices are used simultaneously to double the throughput and the capacity Note: This bit can be modified only when BUSY = 0.

fields.name: FTHRES
fields.description: FIFO threshold level This field defines, in indirect mode, the threshold number of bytes in the FIFO that causes the FIFO threshold flag FTF in XSPI_SR, to be set. ... Note: If DMAEN = 1, the DMA controller for the corresponding channel must be disabled before changing the FTHRES[5:0] value.

fields.name: TEIE
fields.description: Transfer error interrupt enable This bit enables the transfer error interrupt.

fields.name: TCIE
fields.description: Transfer complete interrupt enable This bit enables the transfer complete interrupt.

fields.name: FTIE
fields.description: FIFO threshold interrupt enable This bit enables the FIFO threshold interrupt.

fields.name: SMIE
fields.description: Status match interrupt enable This bit enables the status match interrupt.

fields.name: TOIE
fields.description: Timeout interrupt enable This bit enables the timeout interrupt.

fields.name: APMS
fields.description: Automatic status-polling mode stop This bit determines if the automatic status-polling is stopped after a match. Note: This bit can be modified only when BUSY = 0.

fields.name: PMM
fields.description: Polling match mode This bit indicates which method must be used to determine a match during the automatic status-polling mode. Note: This bit can be modified only when BUSY = 0.

fields.name: CSSEL
fields.description: chip select selection This bit indicates if the XSPI must activate NCS1 or NCS2. Note: This bit can be modified only when BUSY = 0.

fields.name: FMODE
fields.description: Functional mode This field defines the XSPI functional mode of operation. If DMAEN = 1 already, then the DMA controller for the corresponding channel must be disabled before changing the FMODE[1:0] value. If FMODE[1:0] and FTHRES[4:0] are wrongly updated while DMAEN = 1, the DMA request signal automatically goes to inactive state. Note: This bitfield can be modified only when BUSY = 0.

fields.name: MSEL
fields.description: Flash select

fields.name: CKMODE
fields.description: clock mode 0/mode 3 This bit indicates the level taken by the CLK between commands (when NCS = 1).

fields.name: FRCK
fields.description: Free running clock This bit configures the free running clock.

fields.name: CSHT
fields.description: Chip-select high time CSHT + 1 defines the minimum number of CLK cycles where the chip-select (NCS) must remain high between commands issued to the external device. ...

fields.name: DEVSIZE
fields.description: Device size This field defines the size of the external device using the following formula: Number of bytes in device = 2<sup>[DEVSIZE+1]</sup>. DEVSIZE+1 is effectively the number of address bits required to address the external device. The device capacity can be up to 4 Gbytes (addressed using 32-bits) in indirect mode, but the addressable space in memory-mapped mode is limited to 256 Mbytes. In regular-command protocol, if DMM = 1, DEVSIZE[4:0] indicates the total capacity of the two devices together.

fields.name: MTYP
fields.description: Memory type This bit indicates the type of memory to be supported. Note: In this mode, DQS signal polarity is inverted with respect to the memory clock signal. This is the default value and care must be taken to change MTYP[2:0] for memories different from Micron. Others: Reserved

fields.name: PRESCALER
fields.description: Clock prescaler This field defines the scaler factor for generating the CLK based on the kernel clock (value + 1).  ... For odd clock division factors, the CLK duty cycle is not 50 %. The clock signal remains low one cycle longer than it stays high. Writing this field automatically starts a new calibration of high-speed interface DLL at the start of next transfer, except in case XSPI_CALOSR or XSPI_CALISR have been written in the meantime. BUSY stays high during the whole calibration execution.

fields.name: WRAPSIZE
fields.description: Wrap size This field indicates the wrap size to which the memory is configured. For memories which have a separate command for wrapped instructions, this field indicates the wrap-size associated with the command held in XSPI_WPIR. Others: reserved

fields.name: MAXTRAN
fields.description: Maximum transfer This field enables the communication regulation feature. The NCS is released every MAXTRAN+1 clock cycles when the other XSPI request the access to the bus. Others: maximum communication is set to MAXTRAN + 1 bytes.

fields.name: CSBOUND
fields.description: NCS boundary This field enables the transaction boundary feature. When active, a minimum value of 3 is recommended. The NCS is released on each boundary of 2<sup>CSBOUND</sup> bytes. Others: NCS boundary set to 2<sup>CSBOUND</sup> bytes

fields.name: REFRESH
fields.description: Refresh rate This field enables the refresh rate feature. The NCS is released every REFRESH + 1 clock cycles for writes, and REFRESH + 4 clock cycles for reads.  Note: These two values can be extended with few clock cycles when refresh occurs during a byte transmission in single-, dual- or quad-SPI mode, because the byte transmission must be completed. Others: maximum communication length is set to REFRESH + 1 clock cycles.

fields.name: DL
fields.description: Data length

fields.name: DATA
fields.description: Data Data to be sent/received to/from the external SPI device In indirect-write mode, data written to this register is stored on the FIFO before it is sent to the external device during the data phase. If the FIFO is too full, a write operation is stalled until the FIFO has enough space to accept the amount of data being written. In indirect-read mode, reading this register gives (via the FIFO) the data that was received from the external device. If the FIFO does not have as many bytes as requested by the read operation and if BUSY = 1, the read operation is stalled until enough data is present or until the transfer is complete, whichever happens first. In automatic status-polling mode, this register contains the last data read from the external device (without masking). Word, half-word, and byte accesses to this register are supported. In indirect-write mode, a byte write adds 1 byte to the FIFO, a half-word write 2 bytes, and a word write 4 bytes. Similarly, in indirect-read mode, a byte read removes 1 byte from the FIFO, a halfword read 2 bytes, and a word read 4 bytes. Accesses in indirect mode must be aligned to the bottom of this register: A byte read must read DATA[7:0] and a half-word read must read DATA[15:0].

fields.name: CTEF
fields.description: Clear transfer error flag Writing 1 clears the TEF flag in the XSPI_SR register.

fields.name: CTCF
fields.description: Clear transfer complete flag Writing 1 clears the TCF flag in the XSPI_SR register.

fields.name: CSMF
fields.description: Clear status match flag Writing 1 clears the SMF flag in the XSPI_SR register.

fields.name: CTOF
fields.description: Clear timeout flag Writing 1 clears the TOF flag in the XSPI_SR register.

fields.name: LM
fields.description: Latency mode This bit selects the Latency mode. Note: This bit must be set when using the dual-octal HyperBus configuration.

fields.name: WZL
fields.description: Write zero latency This bit enables zero latency on write operations.

fields.name: TACC
fields.description: Access time Device access time expressed in number of communication clock cycles

fields.name: TRWR
fields.description: Read write recovery time Device read write recovery time expressed in number of communication clock cycles

fields.name: INSTRUCTION
fields.description: Instruction Instruction to be sent to the external SPI device

fields.name: TIMEOUT
fields.description: Timeout period After each access in memory-mapped mode, the XSPI prefetches the subsequent bytes and hold them in the FIFO. This field indicates how many CLK cycles the XSPI waits after the clock becomes inactive and until it raises the NCS, putting the external device in a lower-consumption state.

fields.name: INTERVAL
fields.description: Polling interval Number of CLK cycle between a read during the automatic status-polling phases

fields.name: MATCH
fields.description: Status match Value to be compared with the masked status register to get a match

fields.name: MASK
fields.description: Status mask Mask to be applied to the status bytes received in automatic status-polling mode For bit n:

fields.name: TEF
fields.description: Transfer error flag This bit is set in indirect mode when an invalid address is being accessed in indirect mode. It is cleared by writing 1 to CTEF.

fields.name: TCF
fields.description: Transfer complete flag This bit is set in indirect mode when the programmed number of data has been transferred or in any mode when the transfer has been aborted.It is cleared by writing 1 to CTCF.

fields.name: FTF
fields.description: FIFO threshold flag In indirect mode, this bit is set when the FIFO threshold has been reached, or if there is any data left in the FIFO after the reads from the external device are complete. It is cleared automatically as soon as the threshold condition is no longer true. In automatic status-polling mode this bit is set every time the status register is read, and the bit is cleared when the data register is read.

fields.name: SMF
fields.description: Status match flag This bit is set in automatic status-polling mode when the unmasked received data matches the corresponding bits in the match register (XSPI_PSMAR).  It is cleared by writing 1 to CSMF.

fields.name: TOF
fields.description: Timeout flag This bit is set when timeout occurs. It is cleared by writing 1 to CTOF.

fields.name: BUSY
fields.description: Busy This bit is set when an operation is ongoing. It is cleared automatically when the operation with the external device is finished and the FIFO is empty.

fields.name: FLEVEL
fields.description: FIFO level This field gives the number of valid bytes that are being held in the FIFO. FLEVEL = 0 when the FIFO is empty, and 64 when it is full. In automatic-status polling mode, FLEVEL is zero.

fields.name: DCYC
fields.description: Number of dummy cycles This field defines the duration of the dummy phase. In both SDR and DTR modes, it specifies a number of CLK cycles (0-31).

fields.name: DHQC
fields.description: Delay hold quarter cycle

fields.name: SSHIFT
fields.description: Sample shift By default, the XSPI samples data 1/2 of a CLK cycle after the data is driven by the external device. This bit allows the data to be sampled later in order to consider the external signal delays. The software must ensure that SSHIFT = 0 when the data phase is configured in DTR mode (when DDTR = 1.)

fields.name: ALTERNATE
fields.description: Alternate bytes Optional data to be sent to the external SPI device right after the address

fields.name: IMODE
fields.description: Instruction mode This field defines the instruction phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: IDTR
fields.description: Instruction double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the instruction phase.

fields.name: ISIZE
fields.description: Instruction size This bit defines instruction size:

fields.name: ADMODE
fields.description: Address mode This field defines the address phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: ADDTR
fields.description: Address double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the address phase.

fields.name: ADSIZE
fields.description: Address size This field defines address size.

fields.name: ABMODE
fields.description: Alternate-byte mode This field defines the alternate-byte phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: ABDTR
fields.description: Alternate bytes double-transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the alternate-bytes phase.

fields.name: ABSIZE
fields.description: Alternate bytes size This field defines alternate bytes size:

fields.name: DMODE
fields.description: Data mode This field defines the data phase mode of operation.

fields.name: DDTR
fields.description: data double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the data phase.

fields.name: DQSE
fields.description: DQS enable This bit enables the data strobe management.

fields.name: INSTRUCTION
fields.description: Instruction Instruction to be sent to the external SPI device

fields.name: ALTERNATE
fields.description: Alternate bytes Optional data to be sent to the external SPI device right after the address

fields.name: IMODE
fields.description: Instruction mode This field defines the instruction phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: IDTR
fields.description: Instruction double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the instruction phase.

fields.name: ISIZE
fields.description: Instruction size This field defines instruction size.

fields.name: ADMODE
fields.description: Address mode This field defines the address phase mode of operation. Others: reserved

fields.name: ADDTR
fields.description: Address double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the address phase.

fields.name: ADSIZE
fields.description: Address size This field defines address size.

fields.name: ABMODE
fields.description: Alternate-byte mode This field defines the alternate byte phase mode of operation.

fields.name: ABDTR
fields.description: Alternate bytes double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the alternate bytes phase.

fields.name: ABSIZE
fields.description: Alternate bytes size This bit defines alternate bytes size.

fields.name: DMODE
fields.description: Data mode This field defines the data phase mode of operation. 101; data on 16 lines Others: reserved

fields.name: DDTR
fields.description: Data double transfer rate This bit sets the DTR mode for the data phase.

fields.name: DQSE
fields.description: DQS enable This bit enables the data strobe management.

fields.name: INSTRUCTION
fields.description: Instruction Instruction to be sent to the external SPI device

fields.name: DCYC
fields.description: Number of dummy cycles This field defines the duration of the dummy phase. In both SDR and DTR modes, it specifies a number of CLK cycles (0-31).

fields.name: DHQC
fields.description: Delay hold quarter cycle Add a quarter cycle delay on the outputs in DTR communication to match hold requirement.

fields.name: SSHIFT
fields.description: Sample shift By default, the XSPI samples data 1/2 of a CLK cycle after the data is driven by the external device. This bit allows the data to be sampled later in order to consider the external signal delays. The firmware must assure that SSHIFT=0 when the data phase is configured in DTR mode (when DDTR = 1).

fields.name: DCYC
fields.description: Number of dummy cycles This field defines the duration of the dummy phase. In both SDR and DTR modes, it specifies a number of CLK cycles (0-31). It is recommended to have at least 5 dummy cycles when using memories with DQS activated.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Automatic status-polling mode is stopped only by abort or by disabling the XSPI.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Automatic status-polling mode stops as soon as there is a match.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: alternate bytes on a single line

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: CLK must stay low while NCS is high (chip-select released), referred to as clock mode 0.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: CLK must stay high while NCS is high (chip-select released), referred to as clock mode 3.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: NCS stays high for at least 1 cycle between external device commands.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: NCS stays high for at least 2 cycles between external device commands.

variants.name: B_0x3F
variants.description: NCS stays high for at least 64 cycles between external device commands.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: FTF is set if there are one or more free bytes available to be written to in the FIFO

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: FTF is set if there are two or more free bytes available to be written to in the FIFO

variants.name: B_0x3F
variants.description: FTF is set if there are 64 free bytes available to be written to in the FIFO

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: bit n of the data received in automatic status-polling mode is masked and its value is not considered in the matching logic.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: bit n of the data received in automatic status-polling mode is unmasked and its value is considered in the matching logic.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Micron mode, D0/D1 ordering in DTR 8-data-bit mode. Regular-command protocol in single-, dual-, quad-, and octal-SPI modes.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Macronix mode, D1/D0 ordering in DTR 8-data-bit mode. Regular-command protocol in single-, dual-, quad-, and octal-SPI modes.

variants.name: B_0x3
variants.description: Macronix RAM mode, D1/D0 ordering in DTR 8-data-bit mode. Regular-command protocol in single-, dual-, quad-, and octal-SPI modes with dedicated address mapping.

variants.name: B_0x4
variants.description: HyperBus memory mode, the protocol follows the HyperBus<sup> </sup>specification. 8-data-bit DTR mode must be selected.

variants.name: B_0x5
variants.description: HyperBus register mode, addressing register space. The memory-mapped accesses in this mode must be non-cacheable, or indirect read/write modes must be used.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: AND-match mode, SMF is set if all the unmasked bits received from the device match the corresponding bits in the match register.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: OR-match mode, SMF is set if any of the unmasked bits received from the device matches its corresponding bit in the match register.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: alternate bytes on a single line

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: alternate bytes on a single line

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: wrapped reads are not supported by the memory.

variants.name: B_0x2
variants.description: external memory supports wrap size of 16 bytes.

variants.name: B_0x3
variants.description: external memory supports wrap size of 32 bytes.

variants.name: B_0x4
variants.description: external memory supports wrap size of 64 bytes.

variants.name: B_0x5
variants.description: external memory supports wrap size of 128 bytes.
